result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DATES:

Pre-trial conference on June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Calendar call on May 5, 2022 at 08:05 am.

Clerk: Becca.  
Called:  2:35 pm.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.
Defendant Joseph Racine appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for judicial pretrial conference; VRCW.  
Court questions deft. as to status of counsel. Deft. states he was found not eligible for SPD appointment.
Deft. sworn & testifies. 
Court holds Indigency Hearing. Court finds deft. indigent. Court appoints Attorney Michael Hughes. Initial cap set at $1,200.00 w/ repayment of $50.00/month.

COURT sets CC: 05/05/2022 @ 8:05 am. (for further scheduling).

Adj: 2:43 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
